dublin_core.dcvalue: This paper examines how pregnant women living in South Australia use information and communication technologies ICTs principally Internet and mobile phones to access pregnancy related information It draws on 35 semistructured interviews conducted as part of the Health e Baby project a qualitative study designed to assess the information needs and ICT preferences of pregnant women cared for at a South Australian metropolitan teaching hospital Our research shows that although ICTs offer exciting possibilities for health promotion and the potential for new forms of communication networking and connection we cannot assume the effectiveness of communicating through such channels despite near universal levels of ICT access In turn this highlights that if e mediated health promotion is to be effective health promoters and practitioners need to better understand ICT access usage and content preferences of their clients
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-06T18:53:20Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2013-11-18
Pregnant women's use of information and communications technologies to access pregnancy-related health information in South Australia.
